intro: Keerlia effusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved keelweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive, broad, flat structure that gives it its common name. Its small, white or greenish flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Keerlia effusa is often found in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
